subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] misty
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
--0-1653821522-1201925511=:30837
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

I dont use a MAC pc, should be same as any other from here. Sounded like maybe she had a browser conflict. I would suggest she try going to the site then click on file and when it goes to the page that plays it, right below the file it has a download button. Click that and see if it will let ya download. If the website is not loading for you at all then definitely a browser conflict. But the downloads should work same as they do on this group
   
  Misty

bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
          Misty,
Maybe you should field this one, can you explain to ann how she can listen to esnips files?
 
Bruce


  Bruce Halliday 




    
---------------------------------
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
From: lisby@...
Date: Thu, 31 Jan 2008 23:51:55 -0500
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Just an observation on yesterday's file discussion

      Well, I tried to listen to your files and I can't. Maybe it's a Mac thing, but I cannot hear anything on esnips and never have been able to. Unless someone can tell me why and help me overcome what is an absolutely shocking technical ignorance on my part, I can't hear nothin'!   

  Ann
  
    On Jan 31, 2008, at 7:30 PM, bruce halliday wrote:

          Jules,
 
I agree with you 100% but lets be democratic and give the esnips method a try.
I suggest after 1 month evaluate what members think about it and decide what to do from there.
 
Bruce



  Bruce Halliday 




    
---------------------------------
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
From: ghostchasingfool@...
Date: Thu, 31 Jan 2008 16:20:09 -0800
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Just an observation on yesterday's file discussion

        Bruce,
              I have to agree with you.  Given the file folder shortage, I deleted all of my files to give the new comers room.  I hated to do that, given if anyone wanted to revert back to my clips, they could in fact do so and now that can't.   I also hate to have to send someone a link to find my audio on an additional sight.  
   
              Maybe we could comprise and say after "x" amount of days, upon new files being uploaded we could clean house?  I know that not everyone will take it upon themselves to do this, but if they don't (after an announcement from the groups caretakers), if they disappear, its their own fault.
   
               I personally like the single emails announcing each file.  I can go straight to the audio clip and not have to search through previous clips I have already listened to. 
   
  Just my thoughts!
  Juli  

bhali333 <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
      Yesterday I decided to post some files so I posted to a sub folder of 
my main folder in the files section.
I noticed that some people voiced their dislike of sending post notices 
for every file , so I sent none. Just a single post stating that I had 
posted the files and where they could be found.

Now this is the dilemma, If you do not post an announcement for each 
file and you trust that the single post announcing all the files that 
have been posted will suffice, well I don't think so!

I know that most individuals here do not listen to or reply to every 
single file posted but I will usually get some comments on the better 
or more interesting ones. So far from the posting yesterday "NADA"

If anyone saw the post I wrote announcing the files I posted to the 
files section, please for my own satisfaction let me know.

Otherwise I don't think the one post notice thing is gonna cut it!

Bruce
